snomtools.plots package¶

Submodules¶

snomtools.plots.datasets module¶

This file provides scripts for common plotting applications working on DataSets as in snomtools.data.datasets. They use matplotlib.

snomtools.plots.datasets.mark_roi_1d(roi, plot_dest, axis_id=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Marks a ROI in a 1D plot with a span representing the ROI limits.

Parameters:
  • roi – The ROI instance.
  • plot_dest – A matplotlib plot object (like a plot or subplot) to plot into.
  • axis_id – An identifier of the axis along which the plot is.
  • kwargs – Keyword arguments for redirection to matplotlib.axes.axvspan(). Specifies the style to be drawn. Default will be a grey (black colored transparent alpha=0.2) area.
Returns:
snomtools.plots.datasets.mark_roi_2d(roi, plot_dest, axis_vert=0, axis_hori=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Marks a ROI in a 2D plot with a box representing the ROI limits.

Parameters:
  • roi – The ROI instance.
  • plot_dest – A matplotlib plot object (like a plot or subplot) to plot into.
  • axis_vert – An identifier of the vertical axis in the plot.
  • axis_hori – An identifier of the horizontal axis in the plot.
  • kwargs – Keyword arguments for redirection to the Rectangle methor of matplotlib.patches.
Returns:
snomtools.plots.datasets.project_1d(data, plot_dest, axis_id=0, data_id=0, normalization=None, offset=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plots a projection of the data onto one axis. Therefore, it sums the values over all the other axes.

Parameters:
  • data – The DataSet or ROI to plot.
  • plot_dest – A matplotlib plot object (like a plot or subplot) to plot into.
  • axis_id – An identifier of the axis to project onto.
  • data_id – An identifier of the dataarray to take data from.
  • normalization – Method for a normalization to apply to the data before plotting. Valid options: * None, “None” (default): No normalization. * “maximum”, “max”: divide every value by the maximum value in the set * “mean”: divide every value by the average value in the set * “minimum”, “min”: divide every value by the minimum value in the set * “absolute maximum”, “absmax”: divide every value by the maximum absolute value in the set * “absolute minimum”, “absmin”: divide every value by the minimum absolute value in the set * “size”: divide every value by the number of pixels that have been summed in the projection (ROI size)
  • offset – Offset the data by this value. Will be applied AFTER normalization. Unit must be consistent, accordingly, to normalized data.
  • kwargs – Keyword arguments for the plot() normalization of the plot object.
Returns:
snomtools.plots.datasets.project_2d(data, plot_dest, axis_vert=0, axis_hori=1, data_id=0, normalization=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plots a projection of the data onto two axes as a pseudocolor 2d map. Therefore, it sums the values over all the other axes. Using the pcolor function for matplotlib ensures correct representation of data on nonlinear grids.

Parameters:
  • data – The DataSet (or ROI) to plot.
  • plot_dest – A matplotlib plot object (like a plot or subplot) to plot into.
  • axis_vert – An identifier of the first axis to project onto. This will be the vertical axis in the plot.
  • axis_hori – An identifier of the second axis to project onto. This will be the horizontal axis in the plot.
  • data_id – An identifier of the dataarray to take data from.
  • normalization – Method for a normalization to apply to the data before plotting. Valid options: * None, “None” (default): No normalization. * “maximum”, “max”: divide every value by the maximum value in the set * “mean”: divide every value by the average value in the set * “minimum”, “min”: divide every value by the minimum value in the set * “absolute maximum”, “absmax”: divide every value by the maximum absolute value in the set * “absolute minimum”, “absmin”: divide every value by the minimum absolute value in the set * “size”: divide every value by the number of pixels that have been summed in the projection (ROI size)
  • kwargs – Keyword arguments for the plot() normalization of the plot object.
Returns:

snomtools.plots.evaluations module¶

This file provides scripts for common evaluated data as defined in the classes in the evaluation package. They use matplotlib.

snomtools.plots.evaluations.plot_powerlaw(powerlaw, plot_dest, resolution=1000, legend_loc='upper left', log=False)[source]¶

Plots a powerlaw, meaning the intensity values and corresponding linear fit in the double logarithmic plot.

Parameters:
  • powerlaw – A snomtools.evaluation.peem.Powerlaw instance.
  • plot_dest – A matplotlib plot object (like a plot or subplot) to plot into.
  • resolution – int: The number of points to be calculated for plotting the line representing the fit.
  • legend_loc – The parameter to be forwarded to the matplotlib.legend method. If set to ‘None’ or anything that evaluates to False, no legend is drawn.
Returns:
